title: Data Analysis & Information Extraction
text:
In this course we will learn the different steps regarding the data analysis process using R programming language, learning the skills needed while understanding how to do a proper data analytics work.
Welcome Slides & Course Information

title: Data Analysis & Information Extraction
text:
In this course we will learn the different steps regarding the data analysis process using R programming language, learning the skills needed while understanding how to do a proper data analytics work.
Welcome Slides & Course Information

title: Course Units
text: This is the complete course topics we will cover:

title: Course Units
text:
Unit 1: Programming with R
Learn programming basics with R: data types, data structures, variables, programming structures, etc. Find here the slides.

title: Course Units
text:
Unit 2: Exploratory Data Analysis
Learn data visualization, transformation and exploration with the help of the tidyverse ecosystem using ggplot2 and dplyr to explore and transform your data, the unit is divided in three chapters…

Part 1. Visualization
Part 2. Transformation
Part 3. Exporatory Data Analysis

title: Course Units
text:
Unit 3: Data Wrangling
Wrangle your data using tidyverse’s tidyr package, work with relational data using dplyr and wrangle special data types with the help of forcats, lubridate or stringr. Also learn how to import different sources of data into your enviornment with the help of libraries such as readr or readxl.

Part 1. Importing Data
Part 2. Organizing Data
Part 3. Wrangling Data Types

title: Course Units
text:
Unit 4: Modelling
Basic introduction to data modelling with the use of linear models such as linear regression. Find here the slides.

title: Course Units
text:
Unit 5: Communication
Learn how to develop reproducible reports and automate your documentation tasks to improve share of results. Find here the slides.

title: Data Analysis & Information Extraction
text:
Content
The course is divided in five different lessons focused on the different steps for data analysis task:

Programming with R
Exploratory Data Analysis
Data Wrangling
Modelling
Communication

title: Reference Material
text:
The course content is based on the book R for Data Science from Wickham and Grolemund. Units and content has been ordered following 2017 edition, while some content has been updated with the 2023 edition.
You can find the full online book here.
In addition, tidyverse documentation for the different packages used in the course has been referenced. Tidyverse site
